case_vignette: A 22-year-old man comes to the emergency department for pain and swelling of his left knee one day after injuring it while playing soccer. While sprinting on the field, he slipped as he attempted to kick the ball and landed on the anterior aspect of his knee. He underwent an appendectomy at the age of 16 years. His vitals signs are within normal limits. Examination shows a swollen and tender left knee; range of motion is limited by pain. The tibial tuberosity shows tenderness to palpation. The left tibia is displaced posteriorly when force is applied to the proximal tibia after flexing the knee. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. An x-ray of the left knee joint shows an avulsion fracture of the tibial condyle.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have pain and swelling in my left knee since yesterday when I hurt it playing soccer.
How old are you?
I'm 22 years old.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms like fever or redness around the area?
No fever or redness, just swelling and pain in the knee.
Have you taken any medication for the pain?
I haven't mentioned taking any medication for the pain.
Does the pain get worse when you move the knee or when weight is put on it?
Yes, the pain gets worse when I try to move my knee.
Do you have any history of knee problems or previous injuries to the same knee?
No previous knee problems, just an appendectomy when I was 16.
Is the knee swollen to the point where you can't bend it at all?
I can bend it, but the range of motion is limited because of pain.
**Final Diagnosis:** Acute knee sprain or strain from injury during soccer.
